0.text:
At last, the world is hearing the voices of
the real people of Scotland.

10.text: The silent majority will be silent no more.

17.text:
And our patriotic vision - proud of our Scottish
identity, proud of our distinctive Scottish

24.text:
institutions, proud of the Scottish Parliament
that we, not the nationalist party, created.

34.text:
And proud that with the powers of that parliament
we can guarantee that the National Health

44.text:
Service will be in public hands universal,
free at the point of need, as long and ever

51.text: as the people of Scotland want it .

55.text:
And proud also, and proud also, that we are
increasing the powers of that Parliament – faster,

63.text:
safer, better, friendlier change than ever
the Nationalists could propose. And proud

69.text:
too that we co-operate and share, indeed we
Scots led the way in co-operating, sharing

78.text:
across the United Kingdom – common defence,
common currency, common and shared rights

84.text:
from the UK pension to the UK minimum wage,
from each according to his ability to contribute,

90.text:
to each according to his needs, and that is
the best principle that can govern the life

107.text:
And our patriotic vision,
up against a nationalist vision that has only

115.text:
one aim in mind - to break every single constitutional
and political link with our friends, neighbours

124.text:
and friends in the United Kingdom and we will
not have this.

131.text: The vote tomorrow, the vote tomorrow is not about whether Scotland is a nation, we are yesterday, today and tomorrow.

142.text:
It's not about whether there's a Scottish
Parliament we have it, after a referendum

147.text:
10 years ago. It's not about whether there
are increased powers, we are all agreed to

152.text:
increase the powers. The vote tomorrow is
whether you want to break and sever every

159.text:
link and I say let's keep our UK pension,
let's keep our UK pound, let's keep our UK

165.text: passport, let's keep our UK welfare state.

171.text:
And let us, and let us tell the undecided,
the waverers, those not sure how to vote,

183.text: let us tell them what we have achieved together.

186.text:
We fought two world wars together. And there
is not a cemetery in Europe that does not

192.text:
have Scots, English, Welsh, and Irish lying
side-by-side. And when young men were injured

199.text:
in these wars, they didn't look to each other
and ask whether you were Scots or English,

203.text:
they came to each other’s aid because we
were part of a common cause.
